Pre-Game Insights: France head coach Didier Deschamps will not have any of his three Real Madrid players at his disposal for the match.
Ferland Mendy and Eduardo Camavinga were both starters in Los Blancos' 2-0 win over Borussia Dortmund in the Champions League final, and the pair should be given more time to recuperate.
Aurelien Tchouameni missed the Wembley victory due to a foot injury, which plunged his Euro 2024 hopes into doubt, but he has affirmed that he will be OK to take part in the Championships.
Tchouameni has no chance of making the cut here and may also miss France's second friendly of the month with Canada.
Adrien Rabiot and Warren Zaire-Emery - who has also been called up for the 2024 Olympics - are more likely starters in Deschamps's midfield.
Ousmane Dembele, Olivier Giroud and Kylian Mbappe should form the attacking quartet alongside Antoine Griezmann.
Deschamps is still spoiled for choice at the back despite the absences of Mendy and Lucas Hernandez.
The midfield pairing of Zaire-Emery and Rabiot is expected to play behind Griezmann, with Dembele, Mbappe, and Giroud forming the attack.
